snippet: The slow and steady withdrawal of stimulus has not been accompanied by a slow and steady improvement in economic conditions.
abstract: Editorial laments that slow and steady withdrawal of stimulus by the Federal Reserve has not been accompanied by slow and steady improvement in economic conditions; contends situation shows that Fed's moves are more about limits of its present tools to change conditions; warns that only Congress is able to address basic problem of lack of demand on part of consumers and borrowers, but lawmakers refuse or are unable to act.
lead_paragraph: The slow and steady withdrawal of stimulus has not been accompanied by a slow and steady improvement in economic conditions.
